choices.C: The entity is part of an unmanaged solution and another unmanaged entity has a lookup field to the entity on one form.
choices.A: The entity is custom and uses a system-defined global option set.
choices.D: The entity is system-defined and no other items are dependent upon the entity.
choices.B: The entity is part of a managed solution and no other items are dependent upon the entity.

discussion.content:
it should be A. B clearly false
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/customize/delete-custom-entities

We can not delete an entity that is a part of a Managed solution. B is wrong.

As dependency for an entity is present, we can not delete it. C is wrong

System-defined entities can not be deleted. D is also wrong.

A is the only logical solution. 
You cannot delete any part of managed solution so b is wrong,
The Answer is A. it cannot be B.

If the entity you wish to remove is part of a managed solution you will not be able to remove it directly. You would need to remove the entire managed solution.

https://community.dynamics.com/crm/b/crmandunifiedservicedesk/posts/mb2-716-customizing-and-configuration-entities

comments.content: You cannot delete an entity that is part of managed solution.
You cannot delete an entity from a managed solution

questions.question_text: For which of the following scenarios can you delete an entity?

You create a Publisher and add entities to a solution.
What are two outcomes of these actions? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

choices.D: The name for custom entities that you create as part of the solution use the prefix that indicates the publisher.
choices.B: A new section dedicated to the publisher is added to the sitemap.
choices.C: Option sets that you create as part of the solution use the prefix that indicates the publisher.
choices.A: The name for existing custom entities that you add to a solution use the prefix that indicates the publisher.
the ability to change the display name of a system entity
choices.B: the ability to reassign a system dashboard
choices.C: the ability to rename a web resource
choices.D: the ability to add forms to a custom entity

discussion.content: the correct answer should be A
Correct is D. A is tricky, but it refers of a system-entity
Should be A. It is possible to create a new forms

comments.content: the question asks what is possible not what isn't possible, so D is the correct answer

questions.question_text:
You are designing a managed solution that will be deployed to another part of the business. Users may want to customize specific parts of the solution after the solution is installed.
Which capability represents a managed property that users can configure?

You have a Microsoft Dynamics 365 environment. You create and deploy a custom entity.
Which property can you turn off after enabling the property?

choices.B: Configure a 1:N relationship between the Contact entity and Relationship entity.
choices.D: Create a new Activity entity to describe the relationship.
choices.C: Specify the Connection Roles that describe the relationship.
choices.A: Create a new entity named Connection Role that allows staff to connect the Contact records for family members.

questions.question_text:
You are implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 for a medical center.
You need to implement the Connection functionality of Microsoft Dynamics 365 to display family relationships between patients.
What should you do?
